0.description: During peak demand hours, when grid_load increases, electricity prices tend to rise due to heightened consumption pressure on the grid.

1.description: When wind_power increases significantly during the afternoon hours, electricity prices tend to stabilize or decrease due to lower demand and higher renewable energy supply.

2.description: During peak demand hours (typically morning and evening), electricity prices are generally higher due to increased consumption

3.description: On weekends, electricity prices tend to be lower due to reduced industrial and commercial activity

4.description: During summer months, electricity prices tend to increase due to air conditioning demand

5.description: During winter months, electricity prices tend to increase due to heating demand
